discussion.content: AB CORRECT - TESTED

Selected Answer: B
Only B is correct. Answer A is almost correct, however function ROUND negatively affects condition cust_credit limit < 1000 for customers with credit ranging from 999.50 to 999.99. Their credit is rounded to 1000 and condition < 1000 removes these customers from query results. So these customers are not shown in final results, thought their credit is below 1000. Initial instruction requesting to show customers with credit below 1000 is not fulfilled. Answer A is false. Other answers C,D,E do not return correct results.

Selected Answer: AB
Provided answer are wrong! The base! Part IX! :-)
Correct Answer AB

Selected Answer: AB
Why is not AB? 
I know that '%' is only used in LIKE operator.
Doesn't it?
A e C is correct

Selected Answer: AF
Provided answer are correct
AF is correct

choices.A: A substitution variable can be used with any clause in a SELECT statement.
choices.F: A substitution variable prefixed with && prompts only once for a value in a session unless it is set to undefined in the session.
choices.E: A substitution variable can be used only in a SELECT statement.
choices.B: A substitution variable used to prompt for a column name must be enclosed in double quotation marks.
choices.D: A substitution variable prefixed with & always prompts only once for a value in a session.
choices.C: A substitution variable used to prompt for a column name must be enclosed in single quotation marks.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about substitution variables? (Choose two.)

The CUSTOMERS table has a CUST_LAST_NAME column of data type VARCHAR2.

The table has two rows whose CUST_LAST_NAME values are Anderson and Ausson.

Which query produces output for CUST_LAST_NAME containing Oder for the first row and Aus for the second?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct
D is correct

Selected Answer: B
Provided answer is correct

D is OK. B is not the wright answer. You will got an error:

ORA-30001: trim set should have only one character
30001. 00000 - "trim set should have only one character"
*Cause: Trim set contains more or less than 1 character. This is not
 allowed in TRIM function.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
I think B also can be the answer. TRIM(TRAILINIG 'son' from CUST_LAST_NAME) command will delete 'son' from right side. Than Anderson will be Ander, and Ausson will be Aus.

choices.C: SELECT INITCAP(REPLACE(TRIM('son' FROM cust_last_name), 'An', 'O')) FROM customers;
choices.B: SELECT REPLACE(TRIM(TRAILING 'son' FROM cust_last_name), 'An', 'O') FROM customers;

choices.C: A TRUNCATE command issued in a session causes all news in a GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE for the issuing session to be deleted.
choices.B: GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE rows inserted by a session are available to any other session whose user has been granted select on the table.
choices.A: GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE space allocation occurs at session start.
choices.D: A GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE 's definition is available to multiple sessions.
choices.E: A DELETE command on a GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLE cannot be rolled back.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about GLOBAL TEMPORARY TABLES? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
C,D are true
The global temporary table definition is visible to all sessions. Only the data you insert into a session is visible to that session.

Selected Answer: CD
A – false; space is allocated when it is requested/needed, see https://asktom.oracle.com/pls/apex/asktom.search?tag=about-temporary-tables 
B – false; table is visible to other sessions but each session can see only its own data, see https://www.oracletutorial.com/oracle-basics/oracle-global-temporary-table/ 
C – true
D – true 
E – false; commit and rollback are possible in Global Temporary Tables

Selected Answer: CD
Provided answer are corrects.
D C are correct

choices.C: All sessions must have the same timeout value when waiting for resumable space allocations.
choices.E: A user's session may be suspended even if the user has the UNLTMTTED TABLESPACE system privilege.
choices.F: Resumable space allocation may be enabled for some sessions and not others.
choices.B: The AFTER SUSPEND event trigger can itself be suspended due to space conditions.
choices.A: A user's session may be suspended and resumed multiple times.
choices.D: Resumable space allocation is only possible with locally managed tablespaces.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about Resumable Space Allocation in Oracle databases? (Choose three.)

comments.content:
F - False
Resumable Space Allocaton enabled on the instance or session.

discussion.content:
E - is correct
Typically this scenario occurs when a user reaches the limit of his/her COTA on the tablespace in which he/she is performing an operation that requires space allocation (ORA-01536) or when his/her tablespace reaches its maximum size, making it impossible for any user to allocate space (ORA-01652).

Selected Answer: AEF
A - true, "A resumable statement can be suspended and resumed multiple times during execution."
B - false, "SQL statements executed within a AFTER SUSPEND trigger are always non-resumable and are always autonomous."
C - false, ALTER SESSION SET RESUMABLE_TIMEOUT sets specific timeout for the session it is executed in, it does not affect other sessions 
D - false, "There are two ways to specify alert thresholds for both locally managed and dictionary managed tablespaces:"
E - true, there is no notice about UNLIMITED TABLESPACE in documentation claiming this system privilege prevents raising Resumable Space Allocation event 
F - true, ALTER SESSION ENABLE RESUMABLE can be executed in some sessions and it is not necessary to run it in all sessions

Selected Answer: ABF
Correct answer in my opinion.

I also think that AEF a correct, but I find this statement in a book...

"If you create an AFTER SUSPEND ON DATABASE trigger that attempts to fix problems, remember that it might hit a space problem itself."

Watson, John; Watson, John. OCA Oracle Database 12c Installation and Administration Exam Guide (Exam 1Z0-062) (Oracle Press) . McGraw Hill LLC. Kindle Edition.

comments.content: The expression in option B, "may be suspended," suggests that the trigger may not function properly due to resource deficiencies. Therefore, interpreting "suspended" in this context as the trigger being unable to operate as intended seems reasonable. Thus, in this light, option B can be considered correct as it acknowledges that the trigger may not perform effectively due to space limitations.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AEF
Resumable Space Allocation is possible also with Dictionary Managed Tablespaces; with some limitations, but possible, so D is false.

There is nothing that indicates that UNLIMITED TABLESPACE privilege can avoid the Resumable Space Allocation, so E is true.

Also, A and F are correct.
